019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.math.BigDecimal;
022import java.time.Instant;
023import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
024import java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor;
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.HashMap;
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import java.util.StringTokenizer;
032import java.util.TreeMap;
033import java.util.regex.Pattern;
034import java.util.stream.Collectors;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
038import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
040import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
041import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialConfiguration;
042
043/**
044 * A base class for configuration stores. Implementing classes must
045 * override one of the methods {@link #structured(String)} or
046 * {@link #values(String)} as the default implementations of either
047 * calls the other. 
048 */
049@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
050public abstract class ConfigurationStore extends Component {
051
052    public static final Pattern NUMBER = Pattern.compile("^\\d+$");
053
054    /**
055     * Creates a new component with its channel set to itself.
056     */
057    public ConfigurationStore() {
058        // Nothing to do.
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given 
063     * channel. As a special case {@link Channel#SELF} can be
064     * passed to the constructor to make the component use itself
065     * as channel. The special value is necessary as you 
066     * obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its 
067     * constructor.
068     *
069     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
070     * handlers listen on by default and that 
071     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
072     */
073    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel) {
074        super(componentChannel);
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Creates a new component base like {@link #ConfigurationStore(Channel)}
079     * but with channel mappings for {@link Handler} annotations.
080     *
081     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
082     * handlers listen on by default and that 
083     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
084     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements to apply
085     * to the `channels` elements of the {@link Handler} annotations
086     */
087    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel,
088            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
089        super(componentChannel, channelReplacements);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Configuration information should be kept simple. Sometimes, 
094     * however, it is unavoidable to structure the information 
095     * associated with a (logical) key. This can be done by 
096     * reflecting the structure in the names of actual keys, derived
097     * from the logical key. Names such as "key.0", "key.1", "key.2" 
098     * can be used to express that the value associated with "key" 
099     * is a list of values. "key.a", "key.b", "key.c" can be used 
100     * to associate "key" with a map from "a", "b", "c" to some values.
101     * 
102     * This methods looks at all values in the mapped passed as
103     * argument. If the value is a collection or map, the entry is
104     * converted to several entries following the pattern outlined
105     * above.
106     *
107     * @param structured the map with possibly structured properties
108     * @return the map with flattened properties
109     */
110    public static Map<String, Object> flatten(Map<String, ?> structured) {
111        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
112        Map<String, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
113        flattenObject(result, null, structured);
114        return result;
115    }
116
117    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
118    private static void flattenObject(Map<String, Object> result,
119            String prefix, Object value) {
120        if (value instanceof Map) {
121            for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
122                if (entry.getKey().toString().startsWith("/")) {
123                    continue;
124                }
125                flattenObject(result,
126                    Optional.ofNullable(prefix).map(p -> p + ".").orElse("")
127                        + entry.getKey(),
128                    entry.getValue());
129            }
130            return;
131        }
132        if (value instanceof Collection) {
133            int count = 0;
134            for (var item : (Collection<?>) value) {
135                flattenObject(result, prefix + "." + count++, item);
136            }
137            return;
138        }
139        result.put(prefix, value);
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Same as {@link #structure(Map, boolean)} with `false` as
144     * second argument.
145     *
146     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
147     * @return a map with structured values
148     */
149    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
150        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
151    public static Map<String, Object> structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties) {
152        return structure(flatProperties, false);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * The reverse operation to {@link #flatten(Map)}. Entries with
157     * key names matching the pattern outlined in {@link #flatten(Map)}
158     * are combined to a single entry with a structured value (map or
159     * list).
160     *
161     * Usually, only key patterns with consecutive numbers starting 
162     * with zero are converted to lists (e.g. `key.0`, `key.1`, `key.2`).
163     * If entries are missing, the values at that level are converted to 
164     * a `Map<Integer,Object>` with the given entries instead. If 
165     * `convertSparse` is `true`, incomplete index sets such as `key.2`,
166     * `key.3`, `key.5` are converted to lists with the available number 
167     * of elements despite the missing entries. 
168     * 
169     * If the derived class overrides {@link #structured(String)},
170     * the leaf values in the returned structure are the values
171     * provided by the overriding implementation (while 
172     * {@link #values(String))} always provides {@link String}s). 
173     * Some configuration formats define types other then string and
174     * therefore value can be e.g. {@link Integer}s or {@link Instant}s.
175     * In order to support the usage of arbitrary configuration store
176     * implementations, values obtained from the data structure returned
177     * by {@link #structure(Map, boolean)} should always be passed 
178     * through {@link #as(Object, Class)}. This method preserves
179     * non-string objects if they match the requested type or
180     * converts the value from its string representation to the
181     * requested type, if possible.
182     *
183     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
184     * @param convertSparse controls conversion to lists
185     * @return a map with structured values
186     */
187    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
188        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
189    public static Map<String, Object>
190            structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties, boolean convertSparse) {
191        if (flatProperties == null) {
192            return null;
193        }
194        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
195        Map<Object, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
196        for (var entry : flatProperties.entrySet()) {
197            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
198            Map<Object, Object> target = result;
199            // Original key (optionally) consists of dot separated parts
200            StringTokenizer parts = new StringTokenizer(entry.getKey(), ".");
201            while (true) {
202                var part = parts.nextToken();
203                Object key = NUMBER.matcher(part).find()
204                    ? Integer.parseInt(part)
205                    : part;
206                if (!parts.hasMoreTokens()) {
207                    // Last part (of key), store value
208                    target.put(key, entry.getValue());
209                    break;
210                }
211                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
212                var newTarget = (Map<Object, Object>) target
213                    .computeIfAbsent(part, k -> new TreeMap<Object, Object>());
214                target = newTarget;
215            }
216        }
217
218        // Now convert all maps that have only Integer keys to lists
219        for (var entry : result.entrySet()) {
220            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
221        }
222
223        // Return result
224        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
225        Map<String, Object> res = (Map<String, Object>) (Map) result;
226        return res;
227    }
228
229    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ConfusingTernary" })
230    private static Object maybeConvert(Object value, boolean convertSparse) {
231        if (!(value instanceof TreeMap)) {
232            return value;
233        }
234        List<Object> converted = new ArrayList<>();
235        for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
236            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
237            if (converted == null) {
238                continue;
239            }
240            if (!(entry.getKey() instanceof Integer)
241                || !convertSparse
242                    && ((Integer) entry.getKey()) != converted.size()) {
243                // Don't convert, leave as Map.
244                converted = null;
245                continue;
246            }
247            converted.add(entry.getValue());
248        }
249        return converted != null ? converted : value;
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Return the values for a given path if they exists. This
254     * method should only be used in cases where configuration values
255     * are needed before the {@link InitialConfiguration} event is
256     * fired, e.g. while creating the component tree. 
257     * 
258     * @param path the path
259     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
260     */
261    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
262        return structured(path).map(ConfigurationStore::flatten)
263            .map(o -> o.entrySet().stream()
264                .collect(Collectors.toMap(Map.Entry::getKey,
265                    e -> e.getValue().toString())));
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists
270     * as structured data, see {@link #structure(Map)}.
271     * 
272     * @param path the path
273     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
274     */
275    public Optional<Map<String, Object>> structured(String path) {
276        return values(path).map(ConfigurationStore::structure);
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * If the value is not `null`, return it as the requested type.
281     * The method is successful if the value already is of the
282     * requested type (or a subtype) or if the value is of type
283     * {@link String} and can be converted to the requested type. 
284     * 
285     * Supported types are:
286     * * {@link String}
287     * * {@link Number}, converts from {@link String} using
288     *   {@link BigDecimal#BigDecimal(String)}
289     * * {@link Instant}, converts from {@link TemporalAccessor}
290     *   or from {@link String} using {@link Instant#parse(CharSequence)) 
291     * * `Boolean`, converts from {@link String} using
292     *   {@link Boolean#valueOf(String)}
293     * 
294     * @return the value
295     */
296    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ShortMethodName",
297        "PMD.NPathComplexity" })
298    public static <T> Optional<T> as(Object value, Class<T> requested) {
299        // Handle null.
300        if (value == null) {
301            return Optional.empty();
302        }
303        // Is of requested type?
304        if (requested.isAssignableFrom(value.getClass())) {
305            return Optional.of((T) value);
306        }
307        // Convert to Instant, if requested.
308        if (requested.equals(Instant.class)) {
309            if (value instanceof TemporalAccessor) {
310                return Optional.of((T) Instant.from((TemporalAccessor) value));
311            }
312            try {
313                return Optional.of((T) Instant.parse(value.toString()));
314            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {
315                return Optional.empty();
316            }
317        }
318        // Convert to String, if requested.
319        if (requested.equals(String.class)) {
320            return Optional.of((T) value.toString());
321        }
322        // Remaining conversions require a string representation.
323        if (!(value instanceof String)) {
324            return Optional.empty();
325        }
326        if (requested.equals(Number.class)) {
327            try {
328                return Optional.of((T) new BigDecimal((String) value));
329            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
330                return Optional.empty();
331            }
332        }
333        if (requested.equals(Boolean.class)) {
334            return Optional.of((T) Boolean.valueOf((String) value));
335        }
336        return Optional.empty();
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Short for `as(value, String.class)`.
341     *
342     * @param value the value
343     * @return the optional
344     */
345    public static Optional<String> asString(Object value) {
346        return as(value, String.class);
347    }
348
349    /**
350     * Short for `as(value, Number.class)`.
351     *
352     * @param value the value
353     * @return the optional
354     */
355    public static Optional<Number> asNumber(Object value) {
356        return as(value, Number.class);
357    }
358
359    /**
360     * Short for `as(value, Instant.class)`.
361     *
362     * @param value the value
363     * @return the optional
364     */
365    public static Optional<Instant> asInstant(Object value) {
366        return as(value, Instant.class);
367    }
368
369    /**
370     * Short for `as(value, Boolean.class)`.
371     *
372     * @param value the value
373     * @return the optional
374     */
375    public static Optional<Boolean> asBoolean(Object value) {
376        return as(value, Boolean.class);
377    }
378}
